body:
Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) traded 79.74 Million shares on last trading day with closing price of $114.92. Company gross margin stands at 39.50% whereas its return on investment (ROI) is 28.30%. Stock value has moved between $89.09   120.97 in last one year. Analyst s mean target price for Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is $125.46 while analysts mean recommendation is 1.80. AAPL EPS growth this year and EPS growth next year is 42.80%, 7.70% respectively.

Shoppers looking to buy Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) s new iPhone 7 smartphones on Friday better have ordered ahead. Brisk demand left some stores sold out, leaving those who purchased online with the best chance to get their hands on the latest models   and some resorting to extreme measures. Apple stores around the world turned away would-be customers who hadn t already ordered online. At the Covent Garden location in London, a security guard told people to try back in a few days. A few hundred who had booked ahead stood in a barricaded line, in the rain, waiting to collect their devices. In New York at the company s store near Central Park, one man had been waiting in line for three days, and he wasn t even at the front of the queue. Still, he was hopeful he d walk away with a phone.

Chesapeake Energy Corporation (NYSE:CHK) shares moved to $7.35 after starting the day at $7.09 on Friday. CHK market capitalization is 5.64B with 4400 employees. Analyst s mean target price for Chesapeake Energy Corporation (NYSE:CHK) is 5.74 while analysts mean recommendation is 3.20. Its weekly performance is -3.54% while year to date (YTD) performance is 63.33%.

A federal appeals court on Thursday rejected Chesapeake Energy Corporation (NYSE:CHK)  s effort to avoid having to pay $438.7 million, including interest, to investors in a bond dispute. The 2nd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in Manhattan let stand a July 2015 ruling requiring the payout, after the natural gas company waited too long to tell bondholders of its plan to redeem their debt six years early. The appeals court agreed with bond trustee Bank of New York Mellon Corp that holders of Chesapeake s 6.775 percent notes maturing in 2019 were entitled to a special  make-whole  price because of the early redemption.

On last trading day AT&T, Inc. (NYSE:T) traded 41.1 Million shares and was closed at 40.20. Analyst s mean target price for T is 42.83 while analysts mean recommendation is 2.50. Company is -7.59% away from its 52 week high and is moving 32.91% ahead of its 52 week low. T Gross Margin is 54.20% and its return on assets is 3.50%. AT&T, Inc. (NYSE:T) quarterly performance is -0.20% while its price to sale ratio is 1.58 and price to book ratio is 2.01.

AT&T, Inc. (NYSE:T) announced a $65,000 contribution to the Tennessee Board ofRegents (TBR) to support non-traditional, underserved students preparing for high-skill jobs requiring technology-based skills inTennessee community colleges. The donation will fund scholarships to help community college students statewide begin a path toward completing their college degrees. The announcement was made at Chattanooga State Community College.

Twitter Inc (NYSE:TWTR) traded 40.08 Million shares on last trading day with closing price of $19.11. Company gross margin stands at 66.90% whereas its return on investment (ROI) is -7.30%. Stock value has moved between $13.75   31.85 in last one year. Analyst s mean target price for Twitter Inc (NYSE:TWTR) is $16.38 while analysts mean recommendation is 3.00. TWTR EPS growth this year and EPS growth next year is 17.60%, 15.05% respectively.

Twitter Inc (NYSE:TWTR) high-profile debut live-streaming a National Football League game went off without a glitch Thursday night, but low viewership numbers indicate that most football fans still prefer to watch the game on traditional TV. An average audience of 243,000 viewers per minute watched the New York Jets beat the Buffalo Bills via a live-stream broadcast on Twitter, according to the NFL. That pales in comparison with the average of 15.4 million people who watched the game on CBS and the NFL Network.
title: Active Movers: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), Chesapeake Energy Corporation (NYSE:CHK), AT&T, Inc. (NYSE:T), Twitter Inc (NYSE:TWTR) | Benchmark Monitor
